com.stormpath.sdk.factor

Interface Factor<T extends Challenge>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - a subclass of Challenge specifying the kind of Challenge associated with this Factor.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Auditable, Deletable, Resource, Saveable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GoogleAuthenticatorFactor<T>, SmsFactor<T>

    public interface Factor<T extends Challenge>
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable, Auditable
    A factor represents an additional step in authenticating a resource in the realm of Multi Factor Authentication.
    Since:
    1.1.0

    • Method Summary

      • getChallenges

        ChallengeList<T> getChallenges(ChallengeCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the factor's assigned challenges that match the specified query criteria. The Factors utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL - most modern IDEs can auto-suggest and auto-complete as you type, allowing for an easy query-building experience. For example: 
         factor.getChallenges(Challenges.SMS.where(
     Challenges.SMS.status().eq(ChallengeStatus.SMS.WAITING_FOR_VALIDATION))
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        or, if you use static imports: 
         import static com.stormpath.sdk.challenge.Challenges.*;

 ...

 factor.getChallenges(where(
     status().eq(ChallengeStatus.SMS.WAITING_FOR_VALIDATION))
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the smsFactor's challenges that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • getChallenges

        ChallengeList<T> getChallenges(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the sms factor's assigned challenges that match the specified query criteria.

        This method is mostly provided as a non-type-safe alternative to the getChallenges(ChallengeCriteria criteria) method which might be useful in dynamic languages on the JVM (for example, with Groovy): 

         def challenges = factor.getChallenges([createdAt: '2016-01-01', orderBy: 'createdAt desc', limit: 5])
        The query parameter names and values must be equal to those documented in the Stormpath REST API product guide.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../factors/factorId/challenges?param1=value1&...

        If in doubt, use getChallenges(ChallengeCriteria criteria) as all possible query options are available via type-safe guarantees that can be auto-completed by most IDEs.
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the factor's challenges that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.1.0

        T createChallenge(CreateChallengeRequest request)

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        Since:
